ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Speaking of lower levels...
ygData.msgSnippet: Bronze, for the most part, isn t worth the weight - AC ratio.  Banded is almost always better overall.  Unless you stuck all your starting stats in Strength.
ygData.messageBody:
Bronze, for the most part, isn't worth the weight - AC ratio. Banded is
almost always better overall. Unless you stuck all your starting stats in
Strength.

Lyrnia who was in Banded until 20th when she bought a full set of Steel
Plate till she could do the Lambent Quests.


----- Original Message -----
From: "Papa Legba" <legba@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, April 18, 2000 2:39 AM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Speaking of lower levels...


> >
> > Dragoon Dirk
> > Shining Star of Light
> > Avenger's Battleaxe
> > Mistmoore Battledrums
> > Banded armour (and what level should we upgrade to bronze)
>
> Dragoon Dirk: 40P
> Banded Armor is usually less than 1P per AC. Bronze is normally 1+ a
> bit per AC.
> If you can carry it, skip banded and go right to bronze. Its cheap
> enough now, and no one makes banded anymore (since its so unprofitable)
>
> --
> We now return to the non-stop rock.
>
> Matt DeBarger
>
>
> Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
with the subject submissions.
>
>
